intro: Lasiandra mollis, commonly known as the silverleaf lantana, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant is part of the Verbenaceae family and is known for its aromatic leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Lasiandra mollis is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
